results.title: Frames of reference
results.creator_credit: Richard Leacock, Kevin Smith, Stephen White and Educational Services Incorporated Film Division
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Demonstrates the changes in observed motion of a freely falling body viewed from differently moving frames of reference. Donald Ivey and Patterson Hume discuss relative motion, accelerated and inertial frames of reference, and show the inadequacy of Newtonian physics, calling for calculation of fictitious forces to describe relative motions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Leacock, Kevin Smith, Stephen White and Educational Services Incorporated Film Division
results.description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.

results.title: Forces
results.creator_credit: Norton Bloom, Stephen White, Educational Services and Physical Sciences Study Committee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Introduces the principles of mechanics by showing the Cavendish experiment which illustrates the gravitational forces between small objects. Also compares gravitational force with magnetic force. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Energy and work
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Part of the “Physical science study committee series” presents experimental evidence that the work done on a body, measured as the area under the force-distance curve, is a measure of the transfer of kinetic energy to the body calculated from its mass and velocity. Dorothy Montgomery demonstrates the relationships using mechanical devices.
results.description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.

Dorothy Montgomery demonstrates the relationships using mechanical devices.

results.title: Electric Fields
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Discusses an electric field as a mathematical aid and as a physical entity. Experiments demonstrate the vector addition of fields, the shielding effect by closed metallic surfaces and the electric force which drives an electric current in a conductor.

Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.

results.title: Elastic collisions and stored energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Demonstrates the concept of stored energy. Uses the example of collisions between two dry-ice pucks. Cylindrical magnets are mounted on the pucks, producing a repelling force, and the kinetic energy of the pucks is measured. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.

results.title: Coulomb's law
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Demonstrates the inverse square relationship between electric force and distance and shows that electric force is directly proportional to charge.

results.title: Behavior of gases
results.creator_credit: Gene Kearney, John Friedman, Lee Grodzins and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
The Brownian motion as applicable to smoke particles is shown by photomicrography and compared with a mechanical analogue. Animation is used to develop a model for gas pressure based on chaotic molecular motion. This chaotic motion is contrasted with the orderly behaviour of gases as shown by an experiment illustrating Boyle’s Law. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gene Kearney, John Friedman, Lee Grodzins and Educational Services Incorporated

results.title: China: unleashing the dragon
results.creator_credit: Richard Hall and New Eagle International
results.brief_description: Chronicles the transformation currently sweeping over China from its birth under the policies of Deng Xiaoping to the economic, social and cultural realities of modern day China.
results.description: Chronicles the transformation currently sweeping over China from its birth under the policies of Deng Xiaoping to the economic, social and cultural realities of modern day China.

results.title: The Future of Hong Kong: China's gateway to the international community
results.creator_credit: Alex Gibney and New Eagle International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
Examines what may lie ahead for China and Hong Kong and how it will interact with the international cultural and economic community. For some it is a celebration, for others it is a move to be questioned.

results.title: The Heart of the matter: the decline of traditional cultural values
results.creator_credit: Richard Hall and New Eagle International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
Illustrates how changing values and economic pressures are influencing popular culture and traditional values. Profiles a young salesmanager in women’s fashion, who is estranged from her family and communist values and compares a female rock singer with a former star of the Peking Opera. The second part of the program looks at some of the pressures on rural families resulting from the new materialism and rapid economic growth. A range of people voice their concerns about the decline of traditions and the danger of losing the soul of China in the rush for economic and social change.
